FuncDef:
The display power command displays the status of a power module.
The display fan command displays fan status.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the ID of the AP device.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Examples: No Present mode State    InputPower                                         Num
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
During routine maintenance, you can run the display power command to view the status of power modules.
The fan status information includes the slot ID, in-position and registration status, working status, rotation speed, and rotation mode of a fan module.
During routine maintenance, if the temperature of the Router is not within a normal range, run the display fan command to check the fan status.
Follow-up Procedure
If you find that a fan is defective after running the display fan command, you can perform the following operations:
Check that the fan module is properly installed. If necessary, remove and re-install the fan module to ensure that it is properly installed. Then, run the display fan command again to check the fan status.Check whether any fan has failed. If a fan has failed, replace it and install a new fan properly. Then, run the display fan command again to check the fan status.If the fault persists, contact Huawei technical support personnel.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
